revision.text:
Dr. '''Raymond J. Luebbers''' was Professor of Electrical Engineering at [[The Pennsylvania State University]] and [[Ohio University]], a Research Scientist at the [[Lockheed Martin]] Research Laboratory in [[Palo Alto, CA]] and founder of Remcom, Inc.
==Education and academic career== Luebbers received the B.S.E.E. from the [[University of Cincinnati]] with High Honors, and M.S.E.E. and Ph.D. in [[Electrical Engineering]] from [[The Ohio State University]]. He In 1984 he joined the Electrical Engineering Department of [[The Pennsylvania State University]]. During the 1991-1992 academic year he was an [[National Science Foundation]] Visiting Professor in the Faculty of Engineering, [[Tohoku University]], [[Sendai, Japan]].
==Remcom== While a professor at [[The Pennsylvania State University|Penn State]] he founded Remcom, Inc, a company which develops of commercial [[electromagnetism|electromagnetic]] analysis software. In December 2001 he resigned from [[The Pennsylvania State University|Penn State]], retaining the title of Adjunct Professor.
Remcom also performs research and development under contract to government and industry.
It has won awards for innovation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.centredaily.com/2009/10/31/1601180/8-local-firms-to-share-1-million.html |title=8 local firms to share $1 million |publisher=The Centre Daily Times |date=2009-10-31 |accessdate=2010-05-16}} {{Dead link|date=November 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.remcom.com/examples/keyless-entry.html |title=Keyless Entry |publisher=Remcom |date=2010-04-14 |accessdate=2010-05-16}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.remcom.com/meet-remcom-employees/h-scott-langdon-corporate-chief-technology-officer-product-m.html |title=H. Scott Langdon (Corporate Chief Technology Officer. Product Manager, EM Software Tools) |publisher=Remcom |date=2010-04-14 |accessdate=2010-05-16}}</ref> Remcom was one of only five companies to receive a 2001 [[US Army]] Small Business Innovative Research Quality Award.
Luebbers retired from Remcom, Inc. in July 2008 but still consults with the company regularly.<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.articleyoube.com/file/91c5oi935419251r7a/x1u3n550681 |title=Remcom Inc. Announces Change in Corporate Leadership |publisher=Articleyoube.com |date= |accessdate=2010-05-16}}</ref>
==Research and writing== Luebbers has published in the areas of analysis of frequency selective surfaces, applications of the Geometrical Theory of Diffraction, and applications and extensions of the [[Finite-difference time-domain method]]. He is co-author of a book called The Finite Difference Time Domain Method for Electromagnetics.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.crcpress.com/ecommerce_product/product_detail.jsf?catno=8657&isbn=0000000000000&af=W1129 |title=The Finite Difference Time Domain Method for Electromagnetics |publisher=CRC Press |date= |accessdate=2010-05-16}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=00on9fRvJqIC&printsec=frontcover&dq=The+finite+difference+time+domain+method+for+electromagnetics&ei=IHDfS42qJ46WzgTK-ti4CQ&cd=1#v=onepage&q&f=false |title=The finite difference time domain method for electromagnetics By Karl S. Kunz, Raymond J. Luebbers |publisher=Google Books |date= |accessdate=2010-05-16}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.amazon.com/Finite-Difference-Domain-Method-Electromagnetics/dp/0849386578 |title=Finite Difference Time Domain Method for Electromagnetics |publisher=Amazon |date= |accessdate=2010-05-16}}</ref> He has made invited presentations and presented short courses at several international meetings. The paper "FDTD Calculation of Scattering from Frequency-Dependent Materials," by R. Luebbers, D. Steich, and K. Kunz, received the 1993 Schelkunoff Best Paper Award of the [[IEEE]] Antennas and Propagation Society.
He has served on the Board of Directors and as Vice-President of the Applied Computational Electromagnetics Society (ACES).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://aces.ee.olemiss.edu/history.php |title=ACES History |publisher=The Applied Computational Electromagnetics Society |date= |accessdate=2010-05-16}}</ref> He is a Member of International Union of Radio Science (URSI) Commission B, and is a member of [[IEEE]] Standards Coordinating Committee 34 on Electromagnetic Energy Product Performance Safety.
==Awards==
*Elected Fellow of the [[Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers]]
*The paper "FDTD Calculation of Scattering from Frequency-Dependent Materials," by R. Luebbers, D. Steich, and K. Kunz<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://ece.iut.ac.ir/faculty/safian/Papers/FDTD/Dispersive%20medium/PLRC/FDTD%20calculation%20of%20scattering%20from%20frequency-dependent%20materials.pdf |title=FDTD Calculation of Scattering from Frequency-Dependent Materials |format=PDF |first=Raymond |last=Luebbers |coauthors=David Steich, and Karl Kunz |work=IEEE Transactions on Antennas and Propagation |volume= 41 |issue= 9 |date=September 1993 |pages=1249–1257 |accessdate=2010-05-16}}</ref> (September 1993 issue of AP-S Transactions) received the Schelkunoff Best Paper Award of the IEEE Antennas and Propagation Society.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www3.ict.csiro.au/aps/best_papers.htm |title=Winners of S. A. Schelkunoff Transactions Prize Paper Award |publisher=IEEE Transactions on Antennas & Propagation |date=2008-03-12 |accessdate=2010-05-16}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref>
==Select Publications==
*R. Luebbers, A. Smith, S.A. Fast, J.W. Schuster, “A Demonstration of Utilizing High Fidelity Propagation Models for Emitter Localization in Urban Environments,” International Union of Radio Science (URSI), Boulder, CO, January 5–8, 2004. *R. Luebbers, “Using FDTD To Illustrate the Behavior of Double Negative Materials,” 2003 IEEE International Antennas and Propagation Symposium and USNC/CNC/URS North American Radio Science Meeting, pp. 30, June 2003. *C. Penney, R. Luebbers, and J. Schuster. "Scattering from Coated Targets Using a Frequency-Dependent, Surface Impedance Boundary Condition," IEEE Transactions on Antennas and Propagation, vol 44, no 4, pp 434–443, April 1996<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/Xplore/login.jsp?url=http%3A%2F%2Fieeexplore.ieee.org%2Fiel4%2F8%2F10528%2F00489294.pdf%3Farnumber%3D489294&authDecision=-203 |title=Scattering from coated targets using a frequency-dependent, surface impedance boundary condition in FDTD |date=Apr 1996 |last=Penney, |first=C.W. |coauthors=Luebbers, R.J. Schuster, J.W. |work=Antennas and Propagation, IEEE Transactions |volume= 44 |issue= 4 |pages=434–443 |accessdate=2010-05-16}}</ref> *R. Luebbers, "Comparison of Lossy Wedge Diffraction Coefficients with Application to Mixed Path Propagation Loss Prediction", IEEE Transactions on Antennas and Propagation, vol 36, no 7, pp 1031–1034, July 1988.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/Xplore/login.jsp?url=http%3A%2F%2Fieeexplore.ieee.org%2Fiel4%2F8%2F378%2F00007210.pdf%3Farnumber%3D7210&authDecision=-203 |title=Comparison of lossy wedge diffraction coefficients with application to mixed path propagation loss prediction |date=Jul 1988 |last=Luebbers |first=R.J. |work=Antennas and Propagation, IEEE Transactions |volume= 36 |issue= 7 |pages=1031–1034 |accessdate=2010-05-16}}</ref> *R. Luebbers, "Propagation Prediction for Hilly Terrain Using GTD Wedge Diffraction", IEEE Transactions on Antennas and Propagation, vol 32, no 9, pp. 951–955, September 1984.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/Xplore/login.jsp?url=http%3A%2F%2Fieeexplore.ieee.org%2Fiel6%2F8%2F25649%2F01143449.pdf%3Farnumber%3D1143449&authDecision=-203 |title=Propagation prediction for hilly terrain using GTD wedge diffraction |date=Sep 1984 |last=Luebbers |first=R. |work=Antennas and Propagation, IEEE Transactions |volume= 32 |issue=9 |pages=951–955 |accessdate=2010-05-16}}</ref> *R. Luebbers, "Finite Conductivity Uniform GTD Versus Knife Edge Diffraction in Prediction of Propagation Path Loss", IEEE Transactions on Antennas and Propagation, vol 32, no 1, pp. 70–76, January 1984.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/Xplore/login.jsp?url=http%3A%2F%2Fieeexplore.ieee.org%2Fiel6%2F8234%2F25638%2F01143189.pdf%3Farnumber%3D1143189&authDecision=-203 |title=Finite conductivity uniform GTD versus knife edge diffraction in prediction of propagation path loss |date=Jan 1984 |last=Luebbers |first=R. |work=Antennas and Propagation, IEEE Transactions |volume= 32 |issue=1 |pages=70–76 |accessdate=2010-05-16}}</ref>
===University level textbook=== *{{cite book | author=Karl S. Kunz and Raymond J. Luebbers | title=The Finite Difference Time Domain Method for Electromagnetics | publisher=CRC Press | year=1993 | isbn=0-8493-8657-8 | url=http://www.crcpress.com/shopping_cart/products/product_detail.asp?sku=8657&af=W1129}}
